Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw plants with healthy green leaves to show they have enough water.
The student can draw plants with wilted or brown leaves to show they do not have enough water.
The student can include drawings of water (such as raindrops, watering can, or pond) near the healthy plants.
The student can show the lack of water, like dry soil or absence of rain, near the unhealthy plants.
The student can demonstrate the pattern that plants need water to look healthy and grow.
